page.content: ARTS AND CRAFTS IN CRAIL. It is fortunate that some of the old crafts still survive in Crail, e.g. the local blacksmith and the cabinet makers. In 1965 a Pottery was set up in a derelict building, restored to incorporate a large studio above the workshop and wood-fired kiln, making stoneware, earthenware and porcelain. The clay is hand-thrown and the glaze is locally made. It is a family business employing up to 5 people. The Little Gallery has decorated furniture,flower paintings and hand-made bronzes. A new resident in Crail paints flower studies in water colours and oils, which are printed on articles sold by the National Trust & others. His wife is a professional china restorer and remodeller of antique pieces.
